fs.log
Interface LogHistoryModel

All Superinterfaces:
org.apache.log4j.Appender
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractLogHistoryModel, DefaultLogHistoryWindowModel
public interface LogHistoryModel
extends org.apache.log4j.Appender

The basic interface that should be available by every data model representing a LogHistoryWindow.

Author:
Simon Hampe

Method Detail

getLogHistory

java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getLogHistory()
Returns:
A list of all appended messages (a formatted version) , which has possibly been filtered before. The order should represent the order in which they were appended.

isLevelDisplayed

boolean isLevelDisplayed(org.apache.log4j.Level l)
Indicates whether messages of a certain level will be contained in the list returned by getLogHistory()

putFilter

void putFilter(org.apache.log4j.Level l,
               boolean isDisplayed)
Sets, whether messages of a given level should be contained in the list returned by getLogHistory() or not.

getFilterTable

java.util.HashMap<org.apache.log4j.Level,java.lang.Boolean> getFilterTable()
Returns a table containing all Levels for which a flag has been specified, with their respective flags.

addLogHistoryListener

void addLogHistoryListener(LogHistoryListener l)
Registers a listener that will be notified of any changes in the model. (null values will be ignored)

removeLogHistoryListener

void removeLogHistoryListener(LogHistoryListener l)
Removes a listener from the list of registered listeners
